title: 4 Simple Ways to Insert a Picture in PowerPoint

steps.title: Open a project in Microsoft PowerPoint.
steps.content: Open a project in Microsoft PowerPoint. You can download PowerPoint for Windows or use it in a web browser on the Microsoft website .

steps.title: Select the slide where you want the picture.
steps.content: Select the slide where you want the picture. You will see the slides on the left side of the screen. If you don't already have slides, you can easily add or move them . To add a new slide for your picture, click the Home tab and select New Slide . [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the Insert tab.
steps.content: Click the Insert tab. You can find this at the top of the page.

steps.title: Click the arrow below Pictures.
steps.content: Click the arrow below Pictures . This is in the Images group. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click This Device….
steps.content: Click This Device… . A new window will open for you to browse your device for a picture to add. Alternatively, you can select Stock Images to browse Microsoft's library or Online Pictures to use an online image. All of the pictures available are free to use in your PPT.

steps.title: Select the photo you want and click Insert.
steps.content: Select the photo you want and click Insert . If you want to add and select multiple photos, hold down CTRL and click each photo you want to add, and then click Insert . You can also drag and drop a picture file directly onto the PowerPoint slide.

steps.title: Adjust your image to fit your slide.
steps.content: Adjust your image to fit your slide. Click the image to reveal the guidelines. You can click and drag the tiny squares to adjust the image as needed.

steps.title: Insert a picture as a background (optional).
steps.content: Insert a picture as a background (optional). If you want to use an image as the slide background, do the following: Right-click the margin of the slide. Select Insert under Picture source . Select From a File , Stock Images , Online Pictures , or From Icons . Select the photo and click Insert .

steps.title: Open a project in Microsoft PowerPoint.
steps.content: Open a project in Microsoft PowerPoint. You can download the PowerPoint application for Mac or use it in a web browser on the Microsoft website .

steps.title: Select the slide where you want the picture.
steps.content: Select the slide where you want the picture. If you don't already have slides, you can select New Slide to add some.

steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . This is at the top.

steps.title: Click Picture, and then Picture From File.
steps.content: Click Picture , and then Picture From File . Alternatively, you can select Online Pictures to search the web or Photo Browser to use existing photosets on your computer. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Select the photo you want and click Insert.
steps.content: Select the photo you want and click Insert . If you want to add and select multiple photos, hold down Shift and click each photo you want to add, and then click Insert .

steps.title: Adjust your image to fit your slide.
steps.content: Adjust your image to fit your slide. Click the image to reveal the guidelines. You can click and drag the tiny squares to adjust the image to the desired size.

steps.title: Open the slide you want to edit.
steps.content: Open the slide you want to edit. PowerPoint is available for Android in the Google Play Store. Make sure to sign in to your Microsoft account to use it.

steps.title: Select Insert.
steps.content: Select Insert . This is on the floating ribbon.

steps.title: Tap Pictures.
steps.content: Tap Pictures . This is in the menu.

steps.title: Tap Photos.
steps.content: Tap Photos . Alternatively, tap Camera if you want to take a picture to insert instead. You may need to allow permission to access your photos and camera.

steps.title: Select the photo you want to add.
steps.content: Select the photo you want to add. Use the tools at the top of the window to find your files. You can use your gallery or a connected cloud storage, such as Google Photos .

steps.title: Tap the check mark.
steps.content: Tap the check mark. This will add the picture to the slide.

steps.title: Adjust your image to fit your slide.
steps.content: Adjust your image to fit your slide. Tap the image to reveal the guidelines. You can tap and drag the tiny squares to adjust the image as needed.

steps.title: Open the slide you want to edit.
steps.content: Open the slide you want to edit. PowerPoint is available for iPhone and iPad in the App Store. Make sure to sign in to your Microsoft account to use it.

steps.title: Tap Insert.
steps.content: Tap Insert . You can find this on the ribbon.

steps.title: Tap Photos.
steps.content: Tap Photos . Alternatively, tap Camera if you want to take a picture to insert instead. You may need to allow permission to access your photos and camera.

steps.title: Select the photo you want to add.
steps.content: Select the photo you want to add. Use the tools at the top of the window to find your files. You can use your Camera Roll or a connected cloud storage, such as iCloud . The picture will be added to the slide.

steps.title: Adjust your image to fit your slide.
steps.content: Adjust your image to fit your slide. Tap the image to reveal the guidelines. You can tap and drag the tiny squares to adjust the image size as needed.
